item.title: Jamie add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "That is part of the beauty of all literature. You discover that your longings are universal longings, that you're not lonely and isolated from anyone. You belong." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Jamie add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "He did not understand all he had heard, but from his clandestine glimpse into the privacy of these two, with all the world that his short experience could conceive of at their feet, he had gathered that life for everybody was a struggle, sometimes magnificent from a distance, but always difficult and surprisingly simple and a little sad." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Jamie add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description: "It isn't given to us to know those rare moments when people are wide open and the lightest touch can wither or heal. A moment too late and we can never reach them any more in this world. They will not be cured by our most efficacious drugs or slain with our sharpest swords." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Jamie add a quote by Virginia Woolf
item.description: "Second hand books are wild books, homeless books; they have come together in vast flocks of variegated feather, and have a charm which the domesticated volumes of the library lack." -- Virginia Woolf
